name: SPAT
description: The SPaT plugin receives live Signal Phase and Timing data from the Traffic Signal Controller and publishes a J2735 SPAT message.

messageTypes.description: Signal Phase and Timing (SPAT) status for the signalized intersection.

configuration.description: The intersection id for SPAT generated by this plugin (Note Only used in SPAT MODE = BINARY).
The intersection name for SPAT generated by this plugin (Note Only used in SPAT MODE = BINARY).
JSON data defining a list of SignalGroups and phases (Note Only used in SPAT MODE = BINARY).
The IPv4 address of the local computer for receiving Traffic Signal Controller Broadcast Messages.
The local UDP port for reception of Traffic Signal Controller Broadcast Messages from the TSC.
The IPv4 address of the destination Traffic Signal Controller (TSC).
The destination port on the Traffic Signal Controller (TSC) for SNMP NTCIP 1202 communication.
The SNMP Community used for sending SNMP NTCIP 1202 communication to Traffic Signal Controller (TSC). Please refer TSC vendor documentation for SNMP Community.
The format of received SPAT from Traffic Signal Controller (TSC). Acceptance values are BINARY and J2735_HEX.
SPAT Plugin Log Level controls which log statements are printed to the terminal.

Name of the log file for this plugin. If a relative path is provides, this file will create a directory under /var/log/<PluginName> and add the file here. Not including this parameter or setting to (-) will direct log output to stdout which is the default behavior. NOTE: File logging for plugins should only be used for temporary data collection. Current file logging does not have mechanisms to purge data after a certain time or size.
